snippet: The United Nations mission in Libya, which began to withdraw staff members last week because of security concerns, accelerated that withdrawal on Sunday.
abstract: Rival militias in Tripoli, Libya, fight for control of city's main airport, leaving at least six people dead and causing cancellation of international flights; United Nations mission in country accelerates withdrawal of staff members.

byline.contributor: Osama al-Fitory contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations mission in Libya, which began to withdraw staff members last week because of security concerns, accelerated that withdrawal on Sunday.

headline.main: Rival Factions in Libyan Capital Battle for Control of Main Airport
headline.print_headline: Rival Factions in Libyan Capital Battle for Control of Main Airport
